definition: to bring to the same level/to even up/to flare out/to flatten out
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: Crumple a sheet of cooking paper, flatten it, and then place it over the pan.
sentences.chinese: 揉皱一页烹调用纸，再拉平它，然后放在锅上。

sentences.english: After getting up, I picked at the sheet, fluffed up the pillow and made the bed.
sentences.chinese: 起床后，我拉平床单，拍松枕头，把床铺好。
史密斯进的球把比分拉平了。

sentences.english: King hit a home run, evening up the score.
sentences.chinese: 金击出一个全垒打，吧比分拉平了。

sentences.english: Mother brushed off the breadcrumbs and smoothed out the cloth.
sentences.chinese: 母亲把面包屑刷掉，把桌布拉平。
这次打腿有助于拉平身体。

sentences.english: The last goal evened up the score.
sentences.chinese: 最后一球把比分拉平了。

sentences.english: This should even things up a bit.
sentences.chinese: 这样就会使事情拉平一点。

sentences.english: Taylor rose and straightened his yellow and blue striped sweater.
sentences.chinese: 拉平他那件黄蓝两色带条纹的运动衫。

definition: to pull open/to pull apart/to space out/to increase
to pull back/to regain (one's dignity etc)/to recover from (an adverse situation)/to turn the tables
to straighten out/to sort out/to organize
to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
